situation: K was in the music class when the noise from the instruments became overwhelming. K covered his ears, started crying, and attempted to leave the room.
action: The teacher raised her voice over the noise to get K's attention. She insisted K stays in the room and pay attention without addressing his distress from the noise. This made K cry louder and more distressed, eventually bolting out of the class.
effect: K did not settle back into the class and missed the rest of the lesson. The reaction didn't address K's sensory needs and failed to provide a quiet space for him to calm down.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
